problems.title: Find K Closest Elements (Sliding Window)
problems.description:
Given a sorted integer array arr, two integers k and x, return the k closest integers to x in the array. The result should also be sorted in ascending order.
An integer a is closer to x than an integer b if:
|a - x| < |b - x|, or
|a - x| == |b - x| and a < b

Input Format:
First line: three integers n, k, x.
Second line: n space-separated integers (sorted).

Output Format:
Print the k closest integers on a single line, separated by spaces.
problems.constraints:
1 <= k <= arr.length
1 <= arr.length <= 10^4
arr is sorted in ascending order.
-10^4 <= arr[i], x <= 10^4

starterCodes.code:
class Solution:
    def findClosestElements(self, arr, k, x):
        # TODO: Return the k closest integers to x
        pass

if __name__ == '__main__':
    line1 = input().split()
    n, k, x = map(int, line1)
    arr = list(map(int, input().split()))
    sol = Solution()
    res = sol.findClosestElements(arr, k, x)
    print(' '.join(map(str, res)))

hintsList: Think about how to use a sliding window to optimize the solution.
Consider using a frequency map or two pointers to track the window state.
